summary: This is an email chain between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York and another party, discussing scheduling a meeting to seek guidance from the appeals section regarding a question that arose during the review of ESI (Electronically Stored Information) in the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, requesting a meeting to discuss a question about ESI review in the Epstein investigation. Their signature block indicates they are from the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Email Correspondence on ESI Review
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails a colleague to schedule a meeting to seek guidance from the appeals section regarding a question that came up during the review of ESI in the Epstein investigation.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated March 10, 2020, concerning the ongoing Epstein investigation.
The correspondence involves an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York seeking guidance on a question related to the review of Electronically Stored Information (ESI).
The meeting was requested to consult with the appeals section, indicating a procedural or legal question arose during the evidence review process.
The email signature provides the AUSA's office address at One Saint Andrew's Plaza in New York City.
